code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:27 YO f describes recurrent moderate parethesia in lower limbs over the past month. The pt reports severe weight loss, moderate hyperesthesia in lower limbs, Diabetes. she smokes one pack/day for 3 years Patient reports that she never drinks alcohol o:Height 154 cm, Weight 94.6 kg, Temperature 36.7 C, Pulse 79, SystolicBP 115, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 17, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to endocrinology.

td.content: s:pt presents with 5 days history of moderate parethesia in lower limbs. pt also reports moderate hyperesthesia in lower limbs, severe weight loss, Diabetes. pt is a 27 year old female structural engineers. she smokes one pack daily for 3 years denies any alcohol use o:Height 153 cm, Weight 91.9 kg, Temperature 36.5 C, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 15, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed insulin aspart - 100 mg/mL subcutaneous daily.

td.content: s:pt complained of moderate parethesia in lower limbs, severe weight loss, moderate hyperesthesia in lower limbs and Diabetes. patient denied any fall or trauma. NKDA. patient is a 28 yo white f. she smokes 1 pack/day of cigarettes she denies drinking alcohol o:Height 154 cm, Weight 94.8 kg, Temperature 37.2 C, Pulse 65, SystolicBP 115, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 17, HbA1c HbA1c=9 %, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:administered insulin aspart - 100 mg/mL subcutaneous daily, performed HbA1c, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
